<textHeader>SEASON 12 COKE / TEEN PERFECT HARMONY CONCEPT </textHeader> <textBody>This year, we are going to give teens the opportunity to once again help the PH artist write a hit song, but also impact every aspect of the finale performance. Consumers will not only be able to vote on the lyrics of a new song, but they will get to vote on things like set design, wardrobe and choreography.
They will work together to help mold and shape what will ultimately become the artist’s overall performance during the American Idol finale.</textBody>
<textNote>* Concept pending final Legal & Partner approvals. </textNote>

FOODSERVICE: If a QSR or FSR customer is interested in pursuing, a fee will be required to add FS rights for this season. If you are interested, please contact: Jen Kanter // 404-676-0555 / Email OR Jasmin Hodge // (404) 676-3043 / Email CCNA promotions will not use services or marks in such a way as to infringe upon other American Idol partners’ exclusive rights in the Health and Beauty, Retail Apparel, Telephone, Mobile Handset, MP3/Digital Video Hardware and Online Digital Music/Video Download Provider, Automotive, Video Game, and internet service channels. CCNA will have the right to partner with one or more off-air American Idol Season 12 marketing partners simultaneously to create multi-product promotions. The customer’s name, title, and/or mark/logo will be 33% of the size of the Coca-Cola or American Idol Logo (whichever is smaller) or name of CCNA or American Idol Season 11, and will receive subordinate placement. CCNA will have no third-party pass-through rights, meaning the customer’s name, title, and/or mark/logo may be used only in conjunction with the Coca-Cola marks and for informational purposes (such as where the promotion is being conducted). CCNA will have the right to hold promotional American Idol-related events within the Education & College channels; such events subject to Producers’ (Fremantle & 19) reasonable approval. CCNA will have the right to lead these promotions with any CCNA brand based on regulations restricting the promotion of certain beverages in schools. CCNA will have the right to create American Idol-themed locations within customer outlets (including but not limited to Walmart, Target, etc.); such executions subject to Producers’ (FM & 19) approval. CCNA will adhere to the Official American Idol style guide provided by FOX and Producers (FM & 19).

SEASON 12 CREATIVE MANDATORIES
  • Feature Coca-Cola products as lead brand / promotion driver
  • Coca-Cola trademarks should be more prominent and in closer proximity to American Idol logo than the customer trademarks
  • The customer’s name, title, and/or mark/logo will be 33% of the area of the smaller mark or name of CCNA Brand or American Idol Season 11 and will receive subordinate placement
  • Utilize approved creative/POS templates wherever possible
  • Red color palette is ALWAYS preferable to blue; avoid using blue as primary color palette
  • Feature food bundle/offer “available at customer outlet” (customer logo or banner name) as tertiary message
  • Use differentiated color background or borders to create clear separation between the Coca-Cola / American Idol trademarks (brand equity message) and the retail offer
  • Include American Idol Tune-In message
  • CCNA will adhere to the Official American Idol style guide provided by FOX and Producers (FM & 19)
  • Obtain Coca-Cola Entertainment Marketing and FOX/Fremantle/19 approval for creative PRIOR to customer sell-in/creative production

FOOD BUNDLING GUIDELINES – DO’S
  • Obtain approval from FOX/Fremantle/19 for bundle partner prior to customer sell-in/creative production (thru Melanie Gates / email)
  • Use approved Coca-Cola/American Idol Toolkit POS imagery and headlines
  • Highlight Coca-Cola products as lead brand
  • Utilize/Prioritize healthy food bundle options
  • Focus on PL/Regional Brands vs. National Brands
  • Feature food bundle/offer available at customer outlet (banner name) as tertiary message
  • Use differentiated color background or borders to create clear separation between the Coca-Cola/American Idol trademarks (brand equity message) and the retail offer
  • Include American Idol Tune-In message
  • Leverage promotion to secure incremental displays/racks, promotional weeks, or availability

FOOD BUNDLING GUIDELINES – DONT’S
  • Feature Ryan Seacrest on the same plane/background as food items
  • Feature customer banner or food bundle partner in primary or first position in a way that would depict them as lead/sponsor
  • Feature Coca-Cola products or trademarks as secondary positioning
  • Feature customer trademarks or food partner trademarks larger than Coca-Cola or American Idol trademarks
  • Use customer tagline or food partner name/category in association with American Idol trademarks
  • Use too many products that are considered unhealthy / junk food
  • Activate bundle with snack partner without prior American Idol approval (some snacks are an issue)

CUSTOMER PROGRAM APPROVAL PROCESS ALL program concepts must be approved prior to creative development. Request program concept form from Melanie Gates:
  • When submitting files/creative please insert the customer name and what the file is
  • Do not send generic names and #'s as files such as those you receive from agencies
  • Use the following example when naming files: AI12 2013 Starwood microsite or AI12 2013 Ralphs shelf talker
    • Submit Customer Program concept forms to: Melanie Gates - Entertainment Marketing / Email Jen Kanter – Entertainment Marketing Activation / Email Brand and Entertainment Marketing will review materials within 3 business days, and provide initial comments to program manager and/or submit for FOX/Fremantle/19 approval. Allow a minimum of six business days for feedback from FOX/Fremantle/19. Melanie Gates forwards approval and/or comments to the program manager.

AMERICAN IDOL TICKET REQUESTS Ticket requests (both consumer promotion and customer hospitality) should be referenced in the Customer Program concept form submitted to Melanie Gates for approval. For Hospitality packages (tickets, hotel, ground transportation) please request via email. * Hospitality tickets are ONLY for use as hospitality, and are not approvable for use in promotions, charity auctions, etc. Ticket allocations will be based on the level of execution and incremental volume projections for the activation. ALL TICKETS ARE CONSIDERED COMPANY ASSETS AND WILL BE UPLOADED ON TRAMS (COMPANY POLICY) TO RESERVE. TICKETS WILL NOT BE RELEASED UNTIL RESERVED ON TRAMS.
